channel.title: Green Ruby
channel.description: Green Ruby News is a feed of fresh links of the week about ruby, javascript, webdev, devops, collected by mose every sunday

item.title: Green Ruby News #172
item.content:encoded:
#172 - may 22th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Studio Rotate
Simple and classy brand design.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Ruby Remote Meetups
Why meetups should always be physical!? Remote it up!
RbConfig
List of all configuration variables in RbConfig.
Cronally
Schedule cron jobs on AWS instances.
Segment
Analytics API and customer data hub.
Certbot
Lets encrypt client becomes Certbot.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Gush
Workflow runner using Sidekiq and Redis.
mock_server
A lightweight Sinatra application for mock HTTP responses.
typhoeus
Wraps libcurl for making fast and reliable requests.
MiniRacer
Minimal, modern embedded V8 for Ruby.
Paranoia
acts_as_paranoid for Rails 3 and 4.
Brainruby
Ruby... Optimized for Developer Sadness.
Cutestrap
A sassy, opinionated CSS Framework. A tiny alternative to Bootstrap.
Dracula Theme
Dracula is a dark theme for Sublime, Atom, Alfred, Emacs, iTerm, JetBrains, Slack, Sublime Text, Textmate...
Dstat
Versatile resource statistics tool.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Procs and Lambdas: Closures in Ruby may 16
An in-depth look into Ruby's proc and lambda.
5 useful examples from the Ruby Standard Library may 16
The Ruby Standard Library is a series of modules & classes that come with Ruby but are not part of the language itself.
How to get started with a Content Security Policy may 17
A Content Security Policy (CSP) is a great way to reduce or completely remove Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities.
Running concurrent workflows in Ruby may 18
Have you ever struggled with a chain of rake tasks that needed to be run periodically and their runtime was giving you a headache?
Untangling Spaghetti Code: How to Write Maintainable JavaScript may 18
With proper planning, analysis, and a good workflow, it is possible to turn a spaghetti codebase into a clean, organised, and scalable one.
All or Nothing may 18
The all property is a shortcut for resetting all of the properties on a given element.
CSS coding techniques may 18
Some tips and recommendation to write better, easier-to-maintain CSS code.
Get the Lowdown on Ruby Modules may 19
Some developers are still confused about how modules work and how they interact with their own code.
Web Image Effects Performance Showdown may 19
tl;dr: Just don't use canvas for filters.
A bit about decorators and presenters may 20
Dive in to the decorator and presenter pattern and see what makes them simillar, but unique.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Building Fast & Resilient Web Applications (40m) may 20
Carving out the fast path is not enough. We need to make our applications resilient.

item.title: Green Ruby News #171
item.content:encoded:
#171 - may 15th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Stinkdigital
A creative agency website including various interesting UI tricks.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
RubyConf Colombia 2016
This is the second rubyconf in Colombia, RFP are now open.
Structured-text-tools
A list of command line tools for manipulating structured text data

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
active_record_doctor
Detect missing/extraneous indexes in your rails project.
active_interaction
Manage application specific business logic.
rails_soft_deletable
Soft deletable support of ActiveRecord.
fbctf
Platform to host Capture the Flag competitions
gitsome
A Git/shell autocompleter with GitHub integration.
amazon-dsstne
Deep Scalable Sparse Tensor Network Engine (DSSTNE) is an Amazon developed library for building Deep Learning (DL) machine learning (ML) models
gitsome
A supercharged Git/shell autocompleter with GitHub integration.
DistributedLog
High-performance, replicated log service by Twitter.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Store your private data inside a git repository may 8
By git-secret.
Rails Performance and the root of all evil may 9
Make sure the difference is significant before performance refactoring.
Implementing WebSockets in Rails 5 with Action Cable May 9
The real-time web
Knuckles, The Next Level of API Caching may 10
Better caching, in the lineage of Perforated.
How to Build a Math Evaluation Engine may 11
Use tokenization to parse string and build an evaluator.
Don't Forget About Infinite Enumerators may 11
Ways to create a enumerator contains infinity loop.
It Takes All Kinds may 11
Some thoughts about our development ecosystems.
Electron 1.0 is here may 11
Desktop applications—making using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Now with a stable API.
Introducing unlimited private repositories may 11
The new pricing scheme for Github.
A Brain Dump of What I Worked on for Uncharted 4 may 11
Not the usual topics, but Allen is a friend and game mechanics are cool when exposed.
Advanced Ping: httping, dnsping, smtpping may 11
If it pings it's alive.
Grafana 3.0 Stable Released may 11
A pretty good milestone for that emerging star in monitoring world.
DevOps and sharing may 13
Great talk about devops culture.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Make Ruby Great Again on Vimeo (39m) may 9
Talk about RSpec and Rails 5.

item.title: Green Ruby News #170
item.content:encoded:
#170 - may 8th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Pixels by Tomer Lerner
A Designer website, showcasing various projects.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Resources for machine learning in Ruby
A collection of gems and other sources about machine learning in Ruby.
No more errors
A handy list of Ruby's error.
Losant
Internet of Things developer platform.
DevopsWiki
A wiki of Devops Tools, Tutorials and Scripts
SeaLion
View raw output for critical events across servers

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
serviceworker-rails
Use Service Workers with the Rails asset pipeline.
rails-auth
Modular resource-based authentication and authorization for Rails/Rack.
seed_dump
Rails 4/5 task to dump real database data to db/seeds.rb
net-http2
A HTTP/2 client for Ruby.
Redis 3.2.0 is out
This is a big upgrade with various new features for Redis.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Lug-Nut Driven Development (LuDDite) May 2
Some basic principles used for growing a codebase.
Container-Ready Rails 5 May 2
Rails 5 will be the easiest release ever to get running on Heroku.
How to Generate Weighted Random Numbers May 3
Two ways to generate weighted random numbers.
Introducing the CSS Grid Layout May 3
The importance of grids in modern web design is clear from the number of frameworks that implement the grid system to speed up development.
The biggest Rails code smell you should avoid to keep your app healthy May 4
Quick prototyping benefit comes with a cost.
Exploring the Structure of Ruby Gems May 4
Explain how gems loaded to your project.
Saving Bandwidth with Chrome’s Data Saver May 4
Data Saver is a new feature for Chrome that works to reduce mobile data usage significantly.
How to Implement Smooth Scrolling in Vanilla JavaScript May 5
Discover advantages of using CSS solution in this article.
How to Implement Java’s equals Method Correctly May 5
Any implementation of equals must adhere to a specific contract or the class’s equality is ill-defined and all kinds of unexpected things happen.
Use React Today in Ruby by Heading to Cuba May 5
You’ve all heard of React. It’s no longer the new kid on the block.
ImageMagick Is On Fire — CVE-2016–3714 May 5
This vulnerability is tragically easy to exploit.

item.title: Green Ruby News #169
item.content:encoded:
#169 - may 1st 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
The End of the Internet
At the end there was just a map.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Ruby Web Dev The Other Way
Personal ruby web development best practices guide by Ievgen Kuzminov.
CSS Hexagon Generator
Generate your own pure CSS hexagons with box-shadow, border, and background image.
Glot.io
An open source pastebin with runnable snippets and API.
Typatone
The act of writing has always been an art. Now, it can also be an act of music.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Ruby 2.3.1 Released apr 26
This is the first TEENY version release of the stable 2.3 series, there are many bugfixes.
Thredded
A Rails 4.2+ forum engine.
Bumbler
Track the load progress of your Bundler-based projects.
Apnotic
An Apple Push Notification gem able to provide instant feedback.
Memdump
Command line manipulation and analysis tool for Ruby 2.1+ memory dumps.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Blocks, Procs, and Enumerable apr 25
Some basics of ruby, exposed.
A basic HTML5 Template for any project apr 25
As you learn HTML5 and add new techniques to your toolbox, you’re likely going to want to build yourself boilerplate.
Unobtrusive JavaScript via AJAX in Rails apr 26
JavaScript outside of HTML’s page structure not to pollute it.
Improving the Quality of Your CSS with PostCSS apr 26
A way to raise quality in CSS code.
Creating Animated Google Map Markers with CSS and JavaScript apr 26
The Google Maps API lacks flexibility and creativity with map markers.
3 Lightweight React Alternatives: Preact, VirtualDom & Deku apr 26
Why those alternatives might be right for your next project.
5 Career-Ending Mistakes Web Developers Make apr 26
Well, here is a stupid title for a list of common sense points on how to keep a healthy relationship with customers.
Being A Developer After 40 apr 26
Story and insights from a 42 years-old developer.
Have Software Developers Given Up? apr 26
Collection of screenshots from last month demonstrating that the web is full of bugz.
Don’t just check errors, handle them gracefully apr 27
Presentation at the recent GoCon spring conference in Tokyo, Japan.
Switch Git Branches by partial name apr 27
Pretty useful in large projects.
Build a Music Player with React & Electron II: Making the UI apr 27
From mockup to full code.
An Introduction to Using JWT Authentication in Rails apr 28
All you need to know abotu JSON Web Tokens.
Slack bot token leakage exposing business critical information apr 28
Developers are leaking access tokens for Slack widely on GitHub, in public repositories.
How to Use JSON Data Fields in MySQL Databases apr 29
The line between SQL and NoSQL databases has become increasingly blurred.

item.title: Green Ruby News #168
item.content:encoded:
#168 - apr 25th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Quechua
Quite good typography and scrolling pace.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Rails Pacific 2016
Will take place on May 20 and 21, in Taipei.
Microjs
List of JS Micro-Frameworks and Micro-Libraries.
SHOUTCLOUD
OK, it's a joke. Or, is it, really?

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Helpy
A modern, mobile-first helpdesk application built in Ruby.
Thredded
A Rails forums engine.
Grub
Add comments to your Gemfile with each dependency's description.
Hashie
Collection of classes and mixins that make hashes more powerful.
Popper.js
Easily position tooltips, popovers and so on with just a line of code.
Koel
A personal music streaming server.
Modaal
Modaal is a WCAG 2.0 Level AA accessible modal window plugin.
Strman
Javascript string manipulation library without npm dependences.
Consolex
Tool that allows you to attach a web based console to any mix project
Min
A small and fast web browser.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
The Road to Sinatra 2.0 apr 18
The big (ok not so big) plans for the next major release of Sinatra.
How I hunted the most odd ruby bug apr 18
Detailed log of a deep dive bug hunting.
New Reality release: comprehensive docs and other cool things apr 18
Some news from the Reality Gem.
dokku on Ubuntu VM - complete with Rails apr 18
Full setup for in-house heroku-like rails server.
When to avoid the DRY principle apr 19
DRY is a principle, not a dogma, right?
Build A JSON API with rails and jsonapi resources apr 19
Step by step build of a rails json api app.
Changes to test controllers in Rails 5Blog APR 19
Some major changes in Controller tests in Rails 5.
Creating Wavescroll apr 20
Demo of scroll through panels with classic jQuery, SCSS, and HTML.
How Etsy Formats Currency apr 19
How Etsy uses CLDR for currency formatting.
A Comprehensive Look at Events in jQuery apr 20
Almost all user interactions within a webpage can be captured in jQuery as events.
Lint your CSS with stylelint apr 20
CSS authors need linters just like everyone else.
Patterns for testing command line scripts apr 20
Shell scripts also deserve some testing love.
Exorcise Your Newbie Demons by Contributing to Exercism apr 21
Want to contribute to open source but don't know where to start?
How to Create a Static Site with Metalsmith apr 21
Static Site generators offers some of the benefits of a CMS without the hosting, performance and security overheads.
How I Hacked Facebook, and Found Someone's Backdoor Script apr 21
The interesting story of a security research adventure.
Opera VPN: the Future of Private Browsing? apr 22
Opera 38 is the first browser to offer a free, unlimited, native VPN client.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
DHH on Rails performance and speed (63m) apr 20
DHH explains caching, user experience and statistics about Rails' performance doubts.

item.title: Green Ruby News #167
item.content:encoded:
#167 - apr 17th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Nurture Digital
A video content agency, a lot of funny creative videos.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Awesome Ruby
A collection of Ruby libraries, tools, frameworks and software.
booleans.io
Booleans as a service. It may sound like a joke, but hmm.
Kite
The artificial pair programmer that shows you examples, documentation, and even fixes simple errors for you.
Wttr
Weather forecast, ascii style.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Powercore
Extend Ruby core with useful extensions.
Action_cable_client
A ruby client for interacting with Rails ActionCable.
Dogweather
Self-validating Ruby objects.
Rodauth
Authentication and Account Management for Rack Applications.
interact.js
JavaScript drag and drop, resizing and gestures with inertia and snapping.
GoldenLayout
Multi-window javascript layout manager for webapps.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Things to Consider when Metaprogramming in Ruby apr 10
The various tradeoffs to take in account.
Metaprogramming in The Wild apr 11
How are Sinatra and Paperclip making use of metaprogramming.
Differences between load, require, include and extend in Ruby apr 11
The various ways to call one file from another.
Rails File Uploading You Can Believe in with Shrine apr 11
Tutorial about file uploads with Shrine.
The Optimist’s Guide to Pessimistic Library Versioning apr 12
About usage of the pessimistic version operator for gemspec dependencies, the 'x' syntax like ~> 1.x.
Understanding JavaScript Modules: Bundling & Transpiling apr 12
How to use modules inside of the browser.
Don’t you Struct.new(...).new(...) apr 13
Explains why initialize directly from Struct.new(...) is a bad idea.
Rails 5 adds warning when fetching big result set with Active Record apr 13
With large data set there can be memory issues.
A Guide to Proper Error Handling in JavaScript apr 13
Errors are inevitable, it's what you do about them that counts.
360 Degrees Product Viewer apr 13
A simple, interactive resource that can be used to provide a virtual tour of your product.
Authentication in React Native with Firebase apr 13
A illustrated example of authentication implementation using React Native.
Technical Debt: Rescuing Legacy Code through Refactoring apr 13
Some guidelines to help overcome the refactoring fear.
Introduction to Cells: A Better View Layer for Rails apr 14
It is possible to have fully stand-alone view components that can be reused without any pain.
Getting Started with React and JSX apr 14
Yet another introduction to using React.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Mountain West Ruby 2016 apr 14
Talks from Mountain West Ruby 2016
Fragment Caching (7m) apr 14
Make your application faster by leveraging memory and caching fragments of your view.

item.title: Green Ruby News #166
item.content:encoded:
#166 - apr 10th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Panoply
A Creative Company using nice full screen images and videos.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
We Work With Ruby
A job marketplace for rubyists.
Colorion
Curated Color Palettes with Search and Tags Support.
Coders Log
A collection of community link-log about different code topics.
OpenPGP Best Practices
In these troubled times, it's good to refresh our personal cryptography habits.
GitLab Pages
Websites for your GitLab projects, user account or group, like on Github. But not sure it's in the community edition.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
optcarrot
A NES emulator written in Ruby
zxcvbn-ruby
Ruby port of Dropbox's zxcvbn javascript lib
notifyor
Get realtime notifications on desktop (except windows).
Grunt 1.0.0 released apr 4
A big milestone for that well-known javascript processor.
Node-RED
A visual tool for wiring the Internet of Things.
CFSSL
CloudFlare's PKI and TLS toolkit

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
How to Deal with Timezones the Active Support Way apr 3
ActiveSupport in Ruby on Rails 4.0+ has a built in list of all supported timezones on the TimeZone class.
Producing Documentation for Your Rails API apr 5
The quicker a developer can understand and finish up the integration with your API, the fewer headaches your team will have when providing support.
CSS containment apr 5
Some words about the contains property.
Introducing DGit apr 5
A new distributed storage system that dramatically improves the availability, reliability, and performance of serving and storing Git content.
RubyGems.org gem replacement vulnerability and mitigation apr 6
Gem replacement vulnerability on RubyGems.org, gems with hypen in their name are affected.
Some facts about the Ruby Hero awards apr 6
An interesting rant about the Ruby Heroes initiative and how it's organized.
Getting Started with Browserify apr 6
Browserify lets you use require in the browser, the same way you'd use it in Node.
Debouncing and Throttling Explained Through Examples apr 6
Use debounce, throttle and requestAnimationFrame to optimize your event handlers.
Managing Data Storage with Blockchain and BigchainDB apr 6
BigChainDB offers to supply a lot of functionality missing from current NoSQL and distributed databases.
GPG signature verification apr 6
A new feature for Github."
Generate Excel Spreadsheets with Rails and the Axlsx Gem apr 7
Axlsx excels at helping you generate beautiful Office Open XML Spreadsheet documents without having to understand the entire ECMA specification.
Debugging techniques in Elixir apr 7
Other approaches to debugging Elixir code, beyond IO.inspect.
LogZoom, a fast and lightweight substitute for Logstas apr 8
Log data indexer written in Go, competitor of Logstash or Fluentd.
One Rails App With Many Databases apr 9
It may be useful to connect to different databases for a variety of reasons

item.title: Green Ruby News #165
item.content:encoded:
#165 - apr 3rd 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Founder Mantras
Daily mantras and quotes with a nice css.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Ruby Plus Podcast
A new podcast. Formatted like Ruby5, a collection of small news.
Rails Pacific
Second edition of the Taiwan rails conf, will happen on may 20 and 21.
PXtoEM
PX to EM conversion made simple.
Build web application with golang
Online book for building web application on go.
MapHub
Create, share and collaborate interactive maps online.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Ruby 2.1.9 Released mar 30
Ruby 2.1.9 released with many bug fixes and then the 2.1.10 just for version number compat test (means, .9 and .10 are the same).
Sycamore
An unordered tree data structure for Ruby
Query-composer
Composing complex SQL queries by defining subcomponents and the dependencies between them.
Versionaire
Provides immutable, thread-safe, semantic versioning.
Gemsmith
A command line interface for smithing new Ruby gems.
Translateable
Store text data in different languages.
Dossier
Ruby-based report generation/presentation Rails engine.
Db_text_search
A unified interface on top of ActiveRecord for case-insensitive string-in-set querying and full-text search on SQLite, MySQL, and PostgreSQL.
Secret_garden
Access secrets via ENV or some backend service like vault.
Include-media
Sass library for writing CSS media queries in an easy and maintainable way, using a natural and simplistic syntax.
Eeact-storybook
Isolate your React UI Component development from the main app
Netdata
Real-time performance monitoring.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Rails 5 changed Active Job default adapter from Inline to Async mar 29
Quick review of 2 new adapters for ActiveJob.
A Simple Pattern to Generate Reports in Rails mar 29
How to use a pure ruby on rails approach to build reporting for your app and store historical reports.
Processing large CSV files with Ruby mar 29
Few ways to process CSV files with Ruby and measure of the memory consumption and speed performance.
Git 2.8 has been released mar 29
Parallel fetches of submodules, commit identity based only by config, and some security fixes.
Database driven scheduling with Clockwork and ActiveJob mar 31
An introductory tutorial on making event scheduling management more accessible and configurable to administrators through database driven admin interfaces in Rails.
War is Over, or is it? A New Dawn for Microsoft mar 31
Wednesday was a pretty remarkable and historical day for Microsoft.
Implementing Ruby 2.3.0: Enumerable's chunk_while apr 3
Implementing chunk_while in Ruby, a pretty convenient Enumerable method.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Memoization (17m) mar 30
Use memoization to your advantage to cache results in memory to improve speed

item.title: Green Ruby News #164
item.content:encoded:
#164 - mar 27th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Behind The Hashtag: TheDress
The story behind the meme of the multi-colored dress from last year.
Flag Stories
Here is a website for SHeldon Cooper.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Ruby Hero Awards
Nominate your Ruby Heroes today and recognize everyday heroes of the Ruby community.
what-do-you-call-this-in-ruby
Small glossary of terms for all the symbols used in ruby.
Let's Encrypt
Free SSL/TLS Certificates
GitHub Community Cast
New GitHub Community Podcasts.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
passive_record
no-persistence pure ruby relational algebra
haikunator
Heroku-like random name generator.
Addressable
Replacement for the URI implementation that is part of Ruby standard library.
Left_pad
Ruby implementation of famous npm package
Onotole
New flexible Rails project generator
Hotel
local .dev domains for everyone and more!

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
How to Build a Ruby on Rails Engine mar 20
Step by step tutorial to create a rails engine.
TimedSemaphore implementation in Ruby mar 21
Limited calles in a timeframe with threads.
Is your Rails app ready for Production? mar 22
A (subjective) checklist for making sure you have it all covered.
Understanding the Docker Ecosystem mar 22
What's currently available as part of the Docker ecosystem, how it can help you, and how the pieces fit together.
Ruby Design Patterns: Memento mar 23
Look at the Memento design pattern. Firstly,
Sinon Tutorial: JavaScript Testing with Mocks, Spies & Stubs mar 23
How to make unit testing non-trival JavaScript code trivial with the help of spies, stubs and mocks.
Building a Debug Log Filter with Ruby mar 25
An interesting take on filtering logs using ruby script.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
better_errors is better than web-console (5m) mar 23
So why aren't you using it?Go! https://github.com/charliesome/better_errors

item.title: Green Ruby News #163
item.content:encoded:
#163 - mar 20th 2016

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Somerset
A printing design company, with a funny website.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Runnable
A sandbox service that creates full-stack environments for GitHub branches.
Zube
Project management for GitHub issues.
Amphtml
AMP HTML source code, samples, and documentation.
uiGradients
Handpicked collection of colour gradients for designers and developers.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Duckrails
A development tool to quickly & dynamically mock API endpoints.
InfraRuby
A statically typed Ruby on the JVM.
Dry-rb
A collection of Ruby libraries, each intended to encapsulate a common task.
Stateful_enum
A very simple state machine plugin built on top of ActiveRecord::Enum.
Urn
Ruby library to validate and normalize URNs according to RFC 2141.
Unicode-confusable
Unicode::Confusable.confusable? 'ℜսᖯʏ', 'Ruby'.
Telegram-bot
Library for building Telegram Bots with Rails integration.
Clipboard
Ruby access to the clipboard on Windows, Linux, MacOS, Java and Cygwin.
Wolfentext3d
3D dungeon crawling in your terminal.
Autumn AI
The Hacker's Machine Intelligence Platform.
Calendar-heatmap
A d3 heatmap representing time series data similar to github's contribution chart.
Pikaday
Another Datepicker. Lightweight, no dependencies, modular CSS.
Air-datepicker
Yet another jQuery datepicker.
Slush
Streaming scaffolding system: Gulp as a replacement for YeomanGulp as a replacement for Yeoman.
Crystal
Ruby-inspired low level language.
Dejavu
Elasticsearch browser.
LeSSL
A certificate manager for lets-encrypt certificates in ruby.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Creating new content types in Rails 4.2 mar 13
Working with respond_to or respond_with inside rails controllers.
Ruby Design Patterns: Observer mar 14
Separate code concerns and make it adaptable by observer pattern.
Modify Your Ruby App's DNS Lookup mar 14
Custom DNS information within our app, instead of needing to modify your system’s /etc/hosts file.
Rebuilding Git in Ruby mar 14
Overiview of the RGit implementatiion details.
Ruby Bits:Each with object mar 15
TheEnumerable module is the core of everything in Ruby. Meet the each_with_object method.
An Introduction to jQuery’s Deferred Objects mar 16
For a long time, JavaScript developers have used callback functions to perform several tasks.
CSS Exclusions and Grid Layout mar 16
Exclusions specification will be useful for creating layouts on the web once Grid ships in browsers.
Remote Code Execution in all git versions mar 16
This has the potential to be huge: server and client side remote code execution through a buffer overflow.
Firing People mar 16
How can we fix the firing process if we're not even talking about it first.
Tcpdump is amazing mar 16
The case of tracing slow HTTP requests.
The Results of The Ultimate CSS Survey mar 17
3-part survey aimed at gathering info on the habits and preferences of CSS developers in the industry.
Quickly Create a Telegram Bot in Ruby mar 17
Telegram might be a new name to you, but it’s gaining popularity the in the last few years.
How You Can Use Responsive Web Components Today mar 17
Web Components are a W3 specification that enables you to build your own HTML elements.
Ligature Icons via Pseudo Elements and Icon Fonts mar 18
Rather than use text in the HTML though, you can use a pseudo element.
